content: get the two ends to meet make sure that you haven t twisted your strip and then close the triangle as before now ease the two triangles into a regular shape before using your tail of yarn to sew them together working on the wrong side of the star sew the triangles together with one small stitch at each of the six marked points you can thread your needle under the arms of the star to get between points now crochet a length of chain stitches about 15 cm / 6 long i worked 40 chain and sew it to one of the points of the star so that you can hang it up if you want to block your star just pin the wet star out by the points with the right side facing down you could add beads or buttons to the finished star to decorate it further should the fancy take you i also experimented with smaller stars using thin 4 ply yarn about 400 m / 100g and 2 25 mm needles us size 1 this gave me a star that was about 6 cm / 2¼ wide i used a 2 5 mm crochet hook for the hanging chain for this one with variegated yarn i just used the one shade the colour run meant that the two triangles still came out slightly differently and there you have it woven stars from scraps of yarn abbreviations st / sts stitch / stitches k knit p purl ssk slip slip knit see below k2tog knit two stitches together s2kp2 slip two stitches as if to knit them together knit one stitch and pass slipped stitches over two stitches decreased sl 1 slip one stitch pwise purlwise wyif with the yarn held at the front of the work slip slip knit slip two stitches knitwise or knitwise followed by purlwise one at a time insert tip of left needle into stitches from above put yarn round right needle and knit both stitches together copyright and my patterns although i do not allow items made from my patterns to be sold for
